alert.note: Alert for Coweta; Heard; Meriwether; Pike; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 5:22PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Meriwether, west central Pike, southeastern Heard, northeastern Troup and Coweta Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 522 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Harrisonville to Hogansville to Odessadale, and moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Newnan, Greenville, Hogansville, Grantville, Luthersville, Moreland, Sharpsburg, Turin, Haralson, Lone Oak, Gay, East Newnan, Corinth, Rocky Mount, Saint Marks, Mountville, Louise, Arnco-Sargent, Odessadale and Powers Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
